item.title: Crews (2018)
item.description:
Development of a Collisionless Plasma Kinetic Solver and an Investigation of One-Dimensional Plasma Waves and Instabilities #

Shielded potential of a test electron:

\[\phi(r) = \frac{-e}{4 \pi \epsilon_0 r} e ^{- r / \lambda_D}\]

where the Debye length is \( \lambda_D = \sqrt{\frac{\epsilon_0 T_e}{ n_e e}} \) . The mean free path between large-angle collisions is estimated as

item.title: Datta (2021)
item.description:
\[\]

A Domain-Hybridized Plasma Model Using Discontinuous Galerkin Finite Elements #

Models #

Keep in mind that the behavior of a plasma is primarily determined by the ratio between a spatial length of interest and the following reference lengths. The appropriate model for describing a plasma depends on the regime defined by these lengths.
